description.en: A thesaurus of the Eblaite language

definition.en: Cloak; robe; Pasquali, 'Terminologia semitica' (1997), 219‚Äì20, suggests an etymology related to the root ‚àö·∏•tl, 'to wrap'. The number which follows the term might indicate that it was ‚Äòsingle‚Äô (-I) or ‚Äòfolded‚Äô (-II), although a meaning related to the weaving technique (such as tabby or twill) is also a possible explanation. Other translations include: 'un capo di vestiario', Biga and Milano, ARET IV (1984), 284; 'mantello', Archi and Biga, ARET III (1982), 338; Archi, ARET I (1985), 275; Archi, ARET VII (1988), 204; Lahlouh and Catagnoti, ARET XII (2006), 512); ' æ√†.-fabric with single/double weft', Mander, MEE 10 (1990), passim); 'stoffe- æA. a filo singolo/doppio filo', D‚ÄôAgostino, MEE 7 (1996), passim; 'tessile di medio/alta qualit√†', Pomponio, ARET XV/2 (2013), 405); 'cloak', Archi, ARET XX (2018), 268); 'ein Gewand', Samir, ARET XIX (2019), 221.
definition.ebl: Cloak; robe; Pasquali, 'Terminologia semitica' (1997), 219‚Äì20, suggests an etymology related to the root ‚àö·∏•tl, 'to wrap'. The number which follows the term might indicate that it was ‚Äòsingle‚Äô (-I) or ‚Äòfolded‚Äô (-II), although a meaning related to the weaving technique (such as tabby or twill) is also a possible explanation. Other translations include: 'un capo di vestiario', Biga and Milano, ARET IV (1984), 284; 'mantello', Archi and Biga, ARET III (1982), 338; Archi, ARET I (1985), 275; Archi, ARET VII (1988), 204; Lahlouh and Catagnoti, ARET XII (2006), 512); ' æ√†.-fabric with single/double weft', Mander, MEE 10 (1990), passim); 'stoffe- æA. a filo singolo/doppio filo', D‚ÄôAgostino, MEE 7 (1996), passim; 'tessile di medio/alta qualit√†', Pomponio, ARET XV/2 (2013), 405); 'cloak', Archi, ARET XX (2018), 268); 'ein Gewand', Samir, ARET XIX (2019), 221.

definition.en: A kind of long garment, probably a tunic.
definition.ebl: A kind of long garment, probably a tunic.

definition.en: (Some kind of precious apparel); see Waetzoldt, MEE 12 (2001), 325, who tentatively translates 'pendant in the shape of a mountain goat'. Pasquali, 'Lessico' (2005), connects it to ‚àö·∏•rm, 'to cover'; Archi, 'Jewels' (2002), 187, translates 'pettorale'.
definition.ebl: (Some kind of precious apparel); see Waetzoldt, MEE 12 (2001), 325, who tentatively translates 'pendant in the shape of a mountain goat'. Pasquali, 'Lessico' (2005), connects it to ‚àö·∏•rm, 'to cover'; Archi, 'Jewels' (2002), 187, translates 'pettorale'.

definition.en: 'Rain' (when occurring with nig‚ÇÇ-mul(-an); Sallaberger, 'Nachrichten' (2003), 620 and n19, suggests reports of rainfall in neighboring territories were brought to the Palace.

definition.en: '(Partial) sum, total'.
'Selected; of high quality (referred to wool)'.

definition.en: 'House; temple'.
'Temple of the deified ancestors'.
'A warehouse of clothing; house of the garments (an administrative unit of the Palace)'.
'Ribbed clothing (when referred to a textile)'; see also the translation 'tunic with folds' found in Archi, ARET XIV (2023), s.v. AKTUM-TUG‚ÇÇ, 522.
'Linen robe or fabric'; ‚ñ∂Ô∏é gada may refer to both fabric and linen plant/seed, but the presence of the determinative suggests GADA-TUG‚ÇÇ refers specifically to a linen robe or fabric.
definition.ebl: 'Linen robe or fabric'; ‚ñ∂Ô∏é gada may refer to both fabric and linen plant/seed, but the presence of the determinative suggests GADA-TUG‚ÇÇ refers specifically to a linen robe or fabric.

definition.en: 'Linen'; may refer to both fabric and linen plant/seed. Also wr. ‚ñ∂Ô∏é GADA-TUG‚ÇÇ. TM.75.G.10142 has the unique spelling ‚ñ∂Ô∏é GIB‚ÇÉ.GARIG.TUR, see Marchesi, 'Plants and Trees' (2013), 276.
definition.ebl: 'Linen'; may refer to both fabric and linen plant/seed. Also wr. ‚ñ∂Ô∏é GADA-TUG‚ÇÇ. TM.75.G.10142 has the unique spelling ‚ñ∂Ô∏é GIB‚ÇÉ.GARIG.TUR, see Marchesi, 'Plants and Trees' (2013), 276.

definition.en: 'Linen'; may refer to both fabric and linen plant/seed. Wr. ‚ñ∂Ô∏é gada or ‚ñ∂Ô∏é gada<sup>tug‚ÇÇ</sup>. TM.75.G.10142 has the unique spelling ‚ñ∂Ô∏é GIB‚ÇÉ.GARIG.TUR, see Marchesi, 'Plants and Trees' (2013), 276.
'Plot of land'. See also VE 842-844.
'Long garment', see VE 859 gid‚ÇÇtug‚ÇÇ / gu-da-num‚ÇÇ, maybe related to ‚àöqtn, 'to be thin'.

'Lapis lazuli'; attested in VE 868 (not glossed). The term most frequently occurs with the writing ZA:GIN‚ÇÉ, but ‚ñ∂Ô∏é ZA-GIN‚ÇÉ is also attested. The writing ‚ñ∂Ô∏é GIN‚ÇÉ(-GIN‚ÇÉ) is rare. See Pasquali, Lessico (2005) on the uses of this semi-precious stone attested in the administrative record. It seems that lapis lazuli arrived at Ebla through Mari, see Archi, 'Lapis Lazuli and Shells' (2017). On the etymology, see most recently Oreshko, 'Anatolian Linguistic Influences' (2018), 106.

example.en: 5 ma-na ≈°a-pi za-gin‚ÇÉ / mu-DU / Ma-ri‚ÇÇki / iti ig-za 5 minas and 40 shekels of lapis lazuli (ca.2.6 kilos), income from Mari, month II (ARET XIV 90 = ARET VIII 528 = MEE 5 8 = TM.76.G.528 rev.V:6-9)

definition.en: 'Lapis lazuli'; attested in VE 868 (not glossed). The term most frequently occurs with the writing ZA:GIN‚ÇÉ, but ‚ñ∂Ô∏é ZA-GIN‚ÇÉ is also attested. The writing ‚ñ∂Ô∏é GIN‚ÇÉ(-GIN‚ÇÉ) is rare. See Pasquali, Lessico (2005) on the uses of this semi-precious stone attested in the administrative record. It seems that lapis lazuli arrived at Ebla through Mari, see Archi, 'Lapis Lazuli and Shells' (2017). On the etymology, see most recently Oreshko, 'Anatolian Linguistic Influences' (2018), 106.

definition.en: 'Anklet?'; See VE 362 gi≈°-DU / pa‚ÇÇ!(IGI)-a-tu, /pa øamtu/, ‚Äúfoot‚Äù. See Pasquali, Lessico (2005), 35 with bibliography.

KUBƒÄRUM, measure for arids; the origin of term, which is transliterated as gu‚ÇÇ-bar, gu‚ÇÇ-bar, or GU‚ÇÇ-BAR depending on the interpretation, is still debated. Marchesi ('Plants and Trees' [2013], esp. 87n30, with bibliography) reads it an Akkadogram for kubƒÅrum ¬´‚Äúthe large one‚Äù (of the measuring vessels).¬ª Known only at Ebla, it was used for the measurement of arids: it corresponds to 120 assamm≈´ (AN.ZAM, uncertain capacity). Scholars suggest a value of 0.16, 0.5, 0.6, or 0.85 litres: correspondingly, a kubƒÅrum could be of 19.2, 60, 72, or 102 litres.
'(a medicinal plant, probably Acacia)', used to cure cattle; see also VE 291. Wr. ‚ñ∂Ô∏é <sup>gi≈°</sup>gudu‚ÇÑ, ‚ñ∂Ô∏é <sup>u‚ÇÇ</sup>gudu‚ÇÑ
'Saffron yellow; orange'; From West. Sem. ‚àöwrs, 'plante tinctoriale servant √† teindre en jaune rouge√¢tre'.
'(A necklace)'.
'retaining wall'; built in stone.

'(a shiny stone)'; the term comes from ‚àönmr, ‚Äúto shine‚Äù. The connection with alabaster or the like has been made by Pasquali (Lessico [2005], 72, with previous bibliography), since the term appears as na‚ÇÑ na-mur-ra-tum in incantation ARET V 5 = 75.2194.
'Rock crystal'; wr. also ‚ñ∂Ô∏é NA‚ÇÑ-MUL-·∏´u, ‚ñ∂Ô∏é na-ba-·∏´u.

'Decorated'; probably refers to objects decorated with precious stone or gold leaf.
'Scented ointment'; see also Ug. rq·∏•, 'perfume, ointmen' (DUL3, s.v., 735).
